action.action-desc: Mr. Padilla (for himself, Ms. Hirono, Mr. Moran, and Mr. Lankford) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To amend the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to support research and development of ungulate grazing land management techniques for purposes of wildfire mitigation, fuel reduction, and post-fire recovery.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Wildfire Resilience Through Grazing Research Act.

section.header: Grazing for wildfire mitigation research and development
section.text: Section 1672(d) of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (7 U.S.C. 5925(d)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: The term land-grant institution means an 1862 Institution, 1890 Institution, or 1994 Institution (as those terms are defined in section 2 of the Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998 (7 U.S.C. 7601)).
The term ungulate means a hooved grazing mammal.

subparagraph.text: Research and extension grants may be made under this section at land-grant institutions for the purposes of—

clause.text: supporting research and development of ungulate grazing land management techniques that—

subclause.text: promote wildfire mitigation, fuel reduction, and post-fire recovery on public land and private land, including research and development relating to understanding the economic benefits of, and increasing social support for, such activities;

are compatible with activities that protect against adverse environmental effects, including the spread of invasive plant species and disease, soil erosion, water quality degradation, and watershed degradation, such as—

item.text: manipulation of wild ungulate populations through targeted wildlife management; and

clause.text: disseminating information to public and private landowners, land managers, and livestock owners, including through providing educational materials and conducting outreach programs, regarding—

subclause.text: ungulate grazing land management techniques that promote wildfire mitigation, fuel reduction, and post-fire recovery; and
